intro: Hieracium scioides, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and yellow flowers that bloom from June to August. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while the flowers are arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Hieracium scioides is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is considered a common weed in agricultural areas.
